project_descr: Institutional Strengthening to support the National Ozone Office, Environmental Management Authority, and the Government of Trinidad and Tobago for implementation of the Montreal Protocol (MP) provisions

outputs.output_descr: The Institutional Strengthening Phase Seven (VII) extends the institutional strengthening support to the National Ozone Office, Environmental Management Authority, and the Government of Trinidad and Tobago for implementation of the Montreal Protocol

The Institutional Strengthening Phase Six (VI) extends the institutional strengthening support to the National Ozone Office, Environmental Management Authority, and the Government of Trinidad and Tobago for implementation of the Montreal Protocol

Main project objectives for the fifth phase in relation to Trinidad and Tobago's compliance with the provisions of the Montreal Protocol are as follows:
1) Implementation of the second and final phase of the Terminal Phase-out management plan for chlorofluorocarbons.
2) Further strengthening of the system used by customs officers in the monitoring and control of Ozone Depleting Substances (ODS) and ODS-dependent technologies with the objective of identification of gaps and upgrade of the present system to ensure this country's ability to deter the illegal ODS trade.
3) Increase the institutional capacity of the Ntional Ozone Unit.
4) Increase sector and public awareness to ODS issues.
5) Support and monitor the development and implementation of a mandatory refigerant standard.
6) Increase public awareness with respect to Methyl Bromide and its alternatives.
7) Monitor and support the implementation of policies and legislation for the retail wholesale and use of Methyl Bromide, specifically for quarantine and pre-shipment.
8) Monitor the compliance of the complete phase-out of CFCs in Trinidad and Tobago.
9) Increase general knowledge about the Montreal Protocol and the ozone layer.
10) Report annual data to the Multilateral Fund (MLF) Secretariat and the Ozone Secretariat.
